clinical_study.brief_title: Chronic Pain, Life Style Factors and Quality of Life
clinical_study.official_title: Chronic Pain, Life Style Factors and Quality of Life

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic pain, life style factors and quality of life (KROKIETA) is a multicenter study that aims to analyze life style factors, socioeconomic and psychometric properties, metabolic problems, drug use, quality of life and biochemical variables in chronic non-cancer pain patients. The life style factors will be compared to those of normal population. At baseline, the study patients fill in questionnaires (A-E), the patientsÂ´ weight, length, waist and blood pressure are measured, pain-related factors are recorded and blood samples taken. Changes in the quality of life of the study patients will be evaluated by questionnaires during follow-up at 2 years and 5 years.

detailed_description.textblock: Chronic pain co-occurs with risk factors for cardiovascular diseases, depression, smoking and sleep problems. Nutrition and low physical activity may predispose to chronic pain. To gain information on the life style factors of adult chronic pain patients referred to university hospital or central hospital pain clinics in Finland, 477 patients have been recruited to the study. The patients fill in questionnaires on sociodemographic factors, pain, medication, use of health services, physical activity, smoking, use of alcohol or other substances, sleep, quality of life, nutrition and psychological factors at their first visit to the pain clinic. Height, weight, waist circumference, blood pressure and pulse are measured by the study nurse. A blood sample for analysis of blood sugar, cholesterol (total, LDL, HDL), triglycerides, HbA1c and sensitive C-reactive protein (CRP) is taken. The pain clinician records the pain diagnosis, medication and other methods of pain management chosen. The patients will be sent follow-up questionnaires at 2 years and 5 years after baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of quality of life as assessed by 15 Dimensions questionnaire between baseline and 2 years

arm_group.description: Finnish speaking, adult chronic pain patients, aged 18 - 75 years, referred to pain clinic

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples frozen for possible further biochemical analysis (vitamin D, S-PTH, S-TSH, cytokines, P-Ca++)

study_pop.textblock: Adult, Finnish-speaking patients, aged 18-75 years, referred to a pain clinic for multidisciplinary pain treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 18 to 75 years
- chronic non-cancer pain
- Finnish-speaking
- referred to a multidisciplinary pain management center
Exclusion Criteria:
- inability to fill in questionnaires in Finnish
- cancer pain
